Replies.Reply: For Pete's sake, Calvin!  We've got guests!
Well, put it down and come in!
Oh, please don't bring that up!
We'll do this again! Maybe next week.
Time? Oh, no Calvin. It's not time yet. I still have--
Oh, that time! You know Calvin, I'm not sure I'm really ready for this.
Calvin I'm sure everything's going to be all right. I just know it is!
Well, I'm certainly not going to let the pot roast go to waste. Could you just put that seat cover back on that lawn chair?
Shouldn't we at least turn off the phonograph?
Did you rig it to do that? You're so clever.
Calvin, I wish you would have at least let me do the dishes. It's not going to be that easy getting all that dried-
Oh, much worse. But not as bad as that Mexican Jumping Bean dip. You remember that?
How long will we have to stay down here?
But, what if I go into labor? That could happen any time.
Now you listen to me Calvin Webber, when this baby comes, you're going to be out in the waiting room smoking yourself to death with all the other fathers.
As long as we've got that straight.
Maybe I've just got the creeps.
No. No! Calvin, this is different!
Well, I was thinking...in light of the situation...that we should call him Adam.  That's not sacrilegious is it?
And I was wondering...if...if I could have a...
We looked all over for you. What are you doing back here?
Very nice. Unless it caved in, too.
Go to Daddy, Adam. Go to Daddy.
Yes, he's very bright, dear. Much like his father. But you know, Calvin, maybe he's a little...young for school.
Oh, Calvin, I'm not sure we should be making promises that perhaps can't be kept.
Boys! Excuse me, but I believe it's my turn.
Get the presents and do the lights.
Who else would have done it?
What did you wish for, Adam?
Oh, that's just a bunch of baloney! We never believed that in my family!
Oh. A nice one, I hope.
Calvin Webber! What a thing to say!
You never know. You may someday dine at the White House with the president.
Oh, yes.  It just fascinates me how all    these things work.

Replies.Didascalie: (barely a whisper, but definitely tired of his B.S.)

Replies.Reply: Oh my. Oh,my, oh my, oh, my. So, what do we do now?
For how long?  We've just about run out of everything!
No, Calvin.  We're not going to make do.  Not me!  Not Adam.  We're going up no matter what!  We deserve it.
I want him to at least see the sky!
And the ocean!  A mountain range!
Oh, no! Oh, my goodness!   Let's get him into the bedroom.
He seems to be doing all right now.  I don't know if he's had a heart attack or just... a horrifying experience.
Just act normal.  If anybody asks, simply say you're from out-of-town, and that you're in town on business.

I'm going to give you a shopping list and some money.  We need just enough things to get us through the next year or two.  And you'll find most of these items at what used to be called a grocery store or a hardware store.

I don't know how far you'll have to travel to find supplies, but if you can't get home by nightfall, I want you to look for something called a Holiday Inn. Write that down. It's a hotel. There might still be one standing.
I just hope this is still good up there.

Oh, Adam,that would be wonderful if you could find a girl. One who's not a mutant...and hopefully comes from Pasadena. Nothing against Valley girls, but in my day anyhow, the girls from Pasadena, I don't know...always just seemed a little nicer.
Oh, there's also a thing called a liquor store. Write that down.
which should take care of everything.
Your father has a few final words for you. You know, he'd fight a buzz saw for you - he loves you so much. We both do.
Thank you, Calvin. Thank you very much.
My goodness! How bad is it up there?!
How long will you set it for this time?
Well, that's...considerably shorter than before.  I was wondering, Calvin, why set the locks at all.  I mean the radiation is gone and...
Well, please excuse us!  We...we haven't entertained a guest in...um...
What can I offer you, Eve?
No, wait! At least stay for dinner!
Oh, yes! Please, don't mention the Communists!
Eve. I hope I'm not being nosey, but are you and Adam...um...dating?
Oh, my goodness! We almost forgot!
Sorry, honey!  I just got to fooling with this darn rheostat.
So anyhow this duck says to the clerk, "I'd like to buy this lip balm."  And the clerk says, "Will that be cash or a check?"  And the duck says, "Just put it on my bill!"

There currently exists a type of neon light that lasts five years.  But you won't see it on the market. Same is true of batteries. I could take your simple yacht battery and rig it to last a decade, easily.
A veeeery good one, Harold. Free market capitalism may not be a perfect order, but it's the best we've got, or will ever have.  And why?  Three reasons!
I'd say my baseball card collection is as complete as any one I've ever seen.

I'm sorry everyone, but given this extraordinary turn of events, I think it's prudent that we cut the evening short. I'm sure this Cuban thing will resolve itself, but in the meantime...I'd suggest taking a prayerful watch-and-wait stance!
On the contrary, I think we're the only ones who are.
I bet that's a fighter jet on his way to Key West!  Good luck, amigo!
We can listen to the rest downstairs!
I just hope those plates aren't radioactive by tomorrow morning.
Worse than your Kraft Holiday dip?
Yeah, yeah. Okay.  Give me the roast and watch your step.  I'll come back for the radio.
I don't know. For this thing to blow over, it could take days.
Rather safe than sorry. That's my motto!
I've read up on it. I'll deliver the baby myself if I have to.
Oh, no!  It's happened!  Look at that heat!!  All my surface indicators are knocked out!  Oh, my Lord...it's actually happened!!
To keep us from trying to leave. After an atomic blast there's a radiation half-life that lasts thirty five years.
Hey, honey. Don't you worry. We're going to be just fine.
We have to be strong, sweetheart. If not for ourselves, for the child.
I've given you the most well-done cut.
How could you?! This is just like home!
I told you! I've got everything!
The first child to be born on earth after the annihilation!!
No.  I think it's just right.
Oh, I was just examining this rear hatchway.

Well, it's pretty clear that the front entrance caved in when the bomb went off. So, you know, when the time is up, we'll have to return to the surface using, you know, this back entrance.  Which is very nice because it has the service elevator!
Not bad for a three and a half year old! I'd like to see the public school system match that! I don't care how terrific it is!
Nonsense. People have no idea what the human mind is capable of. Look at us!
Yes, you certainly will. And you'll find a nice girl and rebuild America.
I believe there will be other survivors. In fact, I'm guessing there's life on the surface, even now.
Nothing in the world is more fun than learning new things.

This is what money looks like.  It comes like this, in coin, or like this in paper.  Or you can have an "investment."  These are stock "certificates" that we bought in your name.  Of course, they're worthless now, but at one time they were quite valuable.
Sure. Now, let's move on to our French exam.
Sorgen sie bitte dafur das die gepack sorgfaltic behandeldt warren!
You know, you have a wonderful sense of humor, son!  I must say, the acorn doesn't fall very far from the tree.
It's a game, son. I can explain it pretty easily. There's a pitcher.
Uh, no. There's a man who throws the ball -- to a man who has a bat.
No, no! The runner on second goes to third! He's out there!
Because he's forced out at third! It's a force!
Your mom made that all by herself.
If he tells, it won't come true!
Well, we did in my family!
One who doesn't glow in the dark.
Well, we'll be going up in two years.
You know, when we do go up...I'm going to miss this old place. How 'bout you, hon?
I know exactly what you mean!
Should we say a little prayer first?
No, son! We wait for night.  Now...is precisely when... we must be at our...
Replies.Didascalie: (quickly back to business, and way too dramatic)

Replies.Reply: Helen-Thomas-Webber!  Maybe we have been down here a little too long!
It's an archaic colloquialism, roughly meaning..."good".
What?!  A light!  Yes, I've got a light!
Yes, yes, the song.  So tell me...has it been...hell up here?
Yes, I can tell that just looking around.
"Boy?"  Did you say you were a "country boy?"
No, I can't.  I'm sorry!  I have to go!  I have to...
Hello!  How are you this evening?!
I'm going to give it to you straight.
It's not a pretty sight. Some eat out of garbage cans.  Others are...cover your ears, Son, and hum.  I mean that literally and I mean right now!
Others are...multi-sexual.  It seems...they can be both masculine and feminine...simultaneously.
Believe it. He tried to sell me his body, Helen.
They offer lawn furniture as a come on!
They've done a lot of re-building but society, at least as we knew it, has utterly collapsed. People throw up in the streets. Others point guns.
We'll make do.  I'm of the opinion that these mutants will eventually kill each other off and then--
Well, I am the head of this household--
One more thing. If you find a healthy young woman, bring her back with you.
I just wanted to say that I think he's going to be just fine.
And Lord we ask finally that you send an angel to look after and protect our beloved son, Adam.  Amen.
You have something on your forehead.
To keep what's up there from getting down here! It's not the radiation I'm worried about.
Well, in that case...of course, son.
A toast! To Adam and Eve!
Hot Dr. Pepper! Most people don't know how good it is heated up.
That's wonderful. We Webber guys have mighty good luck when it comes to women.
This is great son, just great. By the way, Eve's last name. Rus-to-kov, that's not Russian, is it?
What? Did the politburo just one day say - "We give up?"
My gosh, those Commies are brilliant!
Hah!!! Those cagey rascals! Those sly dissemblers! Those, uh...
They've finally pulled the wool over everybody's eyes!
Replies.Didascalie: (he can't think of another description, so he moves on)

Replies.Reply: Tower. Wolf One. I've got a problem here.
I've got secondaries of an engine fire and I'll need to find a clear area to eject.
I'm marking the 180 radial for five and ejecting.
Say your problem, Wolf One. Are you declaring an emergency?
Roger, Wolf One. Can you make it to the ocean?
An emergency has been declared. I repeat, an emergency has been declared.
The SAR HELO is airborne with you in sight.
Just remember: don't mention the communists!
Well, I wouldn't go that far.
This is my sister and her husband.

With all his money they could have moved to Beverly Hills, but they decided to stay in the Valley.  Calvin spends all his time tinkering out there in his workshop.  If you ask me it's all very strange.
He dug a huge hole out there for a swimming pool. Then he decided he didn't want it and filled the thing in. And what's that big, high fence for?
Calvin's a great guy, but he's a little, you know...
He was the golden-boy professor at Cal Tech.  But then he starts inventing things.
You got me.  Some kind of special synthetic rubber.  And some kind of automated machine.  Anyhow, suddenly he gets rich.  I mean rich!  And quits teaching.
Well, what the heck kind of a marketing system can't get great new products like that out to the public?
Kennedy's going toe-to-toe with Khrushchev on the television!

...this sudden, clandestine decision to station strategic weapons for the first time outside of Soviet soil, is a deliberately provocative and unjustified change in the status quo which cannot be accepted by this country.

...we will not prematurely or unnecessarily risk the cost of worldwide nuclear war, in which even the fruits of victory would be ashes in our mouth.  But neither will we shrink from the risk at any time it must be faced.
According to Caltech, this Webber guy was a bonafide genius and a borderline nutcase.
Unless we get a postcard or somethin', that's my guess.
Well, he and Mrs. Nutcase must have been out here when the plane hit.
The neighbors over there said the guy spent day and night out here. She'd bring him sandwiches and hot Dr.
Well, don't fool with it. If it is a septic tank, I sure as hell don't want to open it. We'll just lay the foundation over it.
...and since it's almost certain that the Webbers were killed, the bank is selling the house and that back parcel over there that's been re-zoned commercial. It's right there on the avenue.
Yeah, I know what you mean. But the price is right.
Is that where the plane crashed?
This place gives me the willies.
Al ice in won der lan.
Look, Daddy. Alice went down a hole, just like us.
Will I ever get to go up on top?
They're pretty.  Can I have them?
Haben sie etuas nettes in leder?!
Holy Cow! What the heck are these?!
These are really swell! I mean swell!
I wished I could meet a girl.
So...we just open this door and go up?
Hey, where are we going?!  Is everything all right?!
Well, do we just go on up?!
I was thinking that, uh...you know, while I was up there and all...that maybe I could, you know...try to meet a girl.  I've, been thinking about that a little...just these last...fifteen years or so.
Heck, I know that mom! You're my parents.
All in yellow?  Oh!  That was my father!
I know it has been terrible.  But it wasn't your fault. And now all the decay is over with and things are going to get better. You understand?
That's always a good idea! Would you like some money? I have a great deal of it.
I have never in my life seen anything like this!!!! Nothing even comes close!!
Oh, my holy stars! A Negro!
Poisonous gas!!  Run for your life, it's invisible poisonous gas!!!
I tried to give the driver this but he wouldn't take it. He seems angry. A lot of people do.
Oh, boy! Here we go! We're moving!
So this is public transportation. My Dad says that it becomes more and more important because of pollution --
Well, thanks for not waving it around.

I have to find that. And a hardware store  and a liquour store and a standing Holiday Inn. Although, I may not need the Holiday Inn. That's still kind of up in the air. It depends really on how things go.
Driver! Please stop the bus immediately! I have to get off!
Do you think I should get a gun?
I'm sorry, what did you call me?
Is this because of the radiation?
I'm looking for all beef patties.
Come on. Frozen. How much are they?

Then I'll need, twelve into nine hundred, seventy-five boxes. And that's almost...five hundred dollars just for the hamburger! And my Mom only gave me three thousand dollars for everything! The yacht batteries!
Oh my. Oh, my goodness gracious! Oh, my...Oh. That is so great!! Man alive!
The name is Adam Webber and I see you buy baseball cards and although these are a lot older than the ones in the window, I was hoping you still might be interested.
I was thinking of selling all the cards.
See, my problem is, all I have are hundred dollar bills and I need something smaller.  Ones, fives, tens.

Replies.Didascalie: (then sensing the need for further clarification)

Replies.Reply: Sir? I would really appreciate it if you wouldn't take the Lord's name in vain again.
I have a big problem with that.
Yes, ma'am.  But my name is Adam.
I didn't want to leave without saying how much I admire your jewelry.
Say,...did you just lose your job because of me?
I just had a mental picture of...
I don't know. Why doesn't it?

Replies.Didascalie: (could be a question, could be an answer.)

Replies.Reply: Yes! Yes! The Holiday Inn! That's exactly right!
If it will make you feel any better, I don't have a gun.
I'm sorry!  I said something wrong, didn't I!  Please forgive me!
Wait! Please wait!  I'll make a deal with you!  I'll give you a Rogers Hornsby, if you'll take me to the hotel!
He's all yours. I was holding him back.
So what?!  I've got two of him!
Perry Como!  You had him!  Go back!
Yeah! Listen to this part. This is where it really takes off!
That was...wonderful!  I've never felt anything like that in my life.
Good evening. I want to stay at this hotel.
I see.  Well, thank you very much.
I was able to get some change downstairs and my father taught me that it's customary to tip in a situation such as this.
Good night!  Sleep tight.  Don't let the bedbugs bite!  That's what my Mom always says...
I guess living up here makes people look older.
Yes. Up here on the fifteenth floor.
I am so glad to see you!!  I thought I'd never see you again!
Can't you please just talk to me for one second?
Troy? Is he your husband? Or a boyfriend?
Cross my heart and hope to die.
Why doesn't it never work out?
Why does it never work out?  You and...men?
Why not go to work for me?
Well, they're not starving yet, but they need help.
Hey!  Pipe tobacco!  I'm going to need all of this! This is swell!
Hey, you know. I was thinking...
We'll have to rent a refrigerated truck for the beef and poultry.
I guess we'll need another locker.
You know, Eve -- don't get mad, okay? -
There's something else I would like you to help me with.
Well, this is going to sound a little crazy.
Well... Okay. I would like you to help me find a...wife.
Because I want to get married.
I don't want to be alone.
It didn't used to be that way.
And if possible, I'd like to marry someone from Pasadena.
That's what I was afraid of.
What do you mean, you can get me laid?
I told you I've never driven before!
You said it would be easy!
Why, thank you!  Very nice to have met you, Cliff!
May I ask you a question?
Actually,no. I was wondering why Cliff likes to wear another man's underpants.
Well, I know Mom sure likes 'em!
It's a very small place. People don't even know it's there.
Maybe Eve can guess.  She's psychic.
I've never met anyone like you in my life.
I've got goose-bumps all over me.
Mt. McKinley.  It's also the highest point in North America.
That would knock my father out.
...I guess it's...just a matter of personal taste.
Whatever you two want. If you've got the time, I've got the wazoo.
It's fine. Just give it a try.
I guess a lot of those tall buildings we saw this morning are new.
But first let me show her these!
Eve, can I skate around your block?
I get it! I finally get it! You have to see it to understand it!
You know, my father -- who is a scientist -- says that everything is a miracle. Everything. Until recently I wasn 't sure what he meant by that.
Replies.Didascalie: (then watching the rain hit the palm of his hand)

Replies.Reply: Then just help me find a girlfriend!
Would you do it just because you're my friend? My very best friend.
Why did you park way back there?
Ladies first, Troy! That was close.
My goodness gracious!  This place is something!
Holy Mo-ly, Miss Pay-o-ly!! This place is neat-o!!
How do you do?! It's very nice to meet you, Jason and Jonathan!
My mother always told me that if you meet a person for the first time it's easier to remember their names if you use those names right away.
Tu parle Francais? Tu a un tres bon accent.
I thought I was here to meet women.
It's a Rob Roy. A very popular drink, I'm told.
Why?!  I think she's very attractive.
Yes, I have a dictionary. But I can't understand for the life of me why you would call her that!  Or why Cliff would say that about you.
What do I say to Miss Sweet when I meet her?
By the way, that's a great play.
Romeo and Juliet. I cried at the end.
Surprising and funny. Well, I know a duck who bought some lip balm...
I was wondering if you might help me.
"Heather?"  I don't believe I've ever heard that name before.
I took a dance lesson everyday of my life until a couple of days ago.
No, I'm not! My mom taught me.
She is a dancer! And a lovely one! You would like her very much! Shall we dance?
No. Would you please excuse me?
I will certainly try.  And thank you both very much for the dance.
Why are you suddenly so mad at me?
I've never lied to you.  I've maybe let you believe things that you wanted to believe, but I've never lied.
No.  I admire you.  I...I fell in love with you the first time I saw you.
I did. I think that you are the most--
All right. Let me tell you the whole thing. In 1962--
Hello, Cliff, how are you this evening?
Thank you very much. But, Cliff, that's my seat. And I was just--
Eve, I don't mean to be rude, and please excuse me Cliff, but Eve, isn't Cliff just a butt with hair?
I'm sorry, and legs. Legs, butt and hair.  Well, isn't he?  And shallow, as well?
Cliff, I must warn you. I know how to defend myself.
It certainly is.  I agree with you completely.
Eve, if you'll let me, I can --
Steady. Steady.  It's going to be all right in no time.
I went to Sophie's and she was very hospitable.

But it just wasn't where I wanted to be so I left as politely as I could and found a taxi.  But I asked the driver to drop me here instead of at the hotel.  There's a song Mister Como sings called "On the Street Where You Live."  You know it?
"All at once am I--several stories high-- knowing I'm--on the street--
Replies.Didascalie: (softly, saying it as much as singing it)

Replies.Reply: In 1962, when the bomb was dropped on Los Angeles, my parents were in our fallout shelter.  That's where I was born. We only survived because it was a huge shelter as fallout shelters go. My father worked on it secretly for years. When he had to, he used contractors, but always from out-of-
Of course.  I shouldn't be over here at this hour.
Not at all.  And Eve thank you for tonight...and for the kiss. My first.
It was at least as good as the sky.
And I think better than the ocean. I'm serious!
No!  There's an Adult Bookstore back there!  I'll be right back!
Okay, Troy!  Let's get those all-beef frozen patties!
No, I wouldn't go in one of those places with a gas mask on.
I thank you very much for the invitation, but I'm quite busy today.
...All right, Eve.  If you say so.
Could I please just go home?  I was lost, but this morning I found home and I promise not to bother any of you ever again.
The key to my hotel room!  I want you to have my baseball cards!
And please be sure to pay my bill!
And thanks for always being happy!
I've got almost everything we need!
...and his church group have volunteered to help us bring the supplies down.  But we've got to hurry.
I think I'm being chased by a psychiatrist.

Uh, Eve...this is Adam.  Look, I just wanted to thank you for everything you did for me...and I wanted to tell you that I...uh...that I wish so many good things for you. I wish so hard that all of your dreams come true. Um...I, uh...
I'd like for you to meet Miss Eve Rustokov.
Mom?  Eve and I have to go.
I can't explain it now.  But I want you to set the locks for two months.
And, I'm asking you to trust me without understanding why.
Eve, I've got to go back! My parents can't handle this up here. And there was no bomb, was there?
See! I can't tell them that!  I can't ever let them know. It makes their life..well, frankly...
You put the tape in here and you get a movie -- in your own home.
No, Mom, I've turned it into Dad's office.
It's kind of a combination television-
It's Ukrainian. Her grandparents immigrated here.
Dad, I don't know how to tell you this. And I was going to wait a while, but I think...Dad,there was no bomb.
Positive. The Soviet Union collapsed without a shot being fired. The Cold War is over.
Yes. That's kind of how it was.
I'm going to need two more banana-
I can't tell the boys from the girls anymore!
I miss those nice flower-power kids.
What the hell kind of music is that?!
I'm selling this place.  I want out of this hell hole!
I'll give it to ya, no money down.
Oh, man. I'm like not sure I like that.
...all of these things...Alcoholics Anonymous...Cocaine Anonymous...Heroin Anonymous.
Shut up! All of these things... ask you to believe in a power greater than yourself! Some sort of God on High!
Let her come!  Let's get this over with!  And please, if there is a God, let it be worse in Bel Air!!
Oh, God!  Oh, God!!  Oh,God, save me!!
Yes!  Yes!  Oh, Lord!  Yes, oh, yes!
Of course you do.  I'll stay here and pray.
No. I don't need money anymore -- I see that now.
The front door is open.  Will you be back?
Give us a sign!  That's all we ask!
Praise the Lord.  And I mean the real one.
watching the cars fly by on the wet avenue.  Suddenly, a cross-dressing STREET WALKER steps up to him with a cigarette.
The blast?  Honey, I have survived a host of things. Like the song says: "A country boy can survive!"
"Hell up here?"  Honey, it's been hell up here, down there and over yonder!
Cute Little Old Man, if you want a boy, I can be a boy.  And if you want a girl, I can be a girl.  I can be anything you want me to be!
And if you act now, I might even throw in some free lawn furniture.
What is it?!  What do you see?!
Believe me, all the really good stuff is right here.
There's a grocery store coming up.
For the love of God! Let him off the bus!! Can't you see he's meshugina!
is in a sleeveless undershirt and baggy bathing trunks.
Fill this out please. And I'll need a card.
Frozen, they're six-thirty a dozen in the three pound box.
You could have a meat order that big delivered to your home.

Replies.Reply: How--how much do you want for the Mickey Mantle, rookie season?
I see what ya mean. Tell you what...I'll give you five hundred dollars in small bills for the whole box.
I'm workin' here, Evey-poo.  Don't screw me up.
Oh, no! I fired ya! Just like the hair salon guy and the Chevy dealer!  You know why you can't keep a goddamn job?!  Because you can't keep your goddamn mouth shut!  That's why!
Oh, you got a problem with that?
Hah!  Adam and Eve!  The perfect match!  I hope you two will be very happy together!  Mazel-fuckin'-tov!
Hey, smart ass, how 'bout I kick your butt?
Well, your business must not be sports memorabilia, because this one Mantle card right here--
--is worth six thousand dollars all by its little self.
No, you get out of here.
No, ferry--excuse me, Jerry, I quit.
Come on, Heathcliff, I'll walk you to the corner.
We? I'm going home. And, judging by that coat, I'd say you have to get back to the barber college.
Forget it.  I'm sick of working for that dickhead.
A walking penis capable of intelligent speech.  A dickhead.
Well, I guess because I'm a little psychic...I have this thing.
Let me guess something. This is your first visit to La La Land. You're staying somewhere over in Hollywood because, like an idiot, you thought that would be an exciting place to stay.  Right so far?
I knew it! So anyhow, you get on a bus and before you know it, you're out here in the San Fernando Valley without a clue.  Which brings us to here.  Correct again?
Where are you staying? The Holiday Inn?
See? I'm psychic. Not completely, but pretty much. That was pretty good, wasn't it?!
Yeah. Thanks. Anyhow, let me predict a bus for you to get on.
I'm not taking you there, Sweetie.
Well, that changes everything. Get the fuck away from me!!  I mean it!!
Rogers Hornsby's worth like four thousand dollars!
So for four thousand dollars, all I have to do is drive you to your hotel?
I don't have to take a physical in your space ship?
Okay.  What the hell?  You got a deal.
Why am I doing this? What in the hell is wrong with me? That's what I'd like to know.
So...Mister Andretti, your first time on the freeway?
Mind if I change the station?
I can't help it. Perry Como always does this to me! I just get so cranked!
Yeah, same here. Don't forget your suitcase.
What in the hell am I doing here?!
All I know is that his first name is Adam.  No!  Adam Webber!  That's it.
Hi. This is the woman from the baseball card store.  Remember me?
Good grief. Hey listen, I'm in the lobby.
On the first floor! Where the hell else would it be?
you home. I wish I could, but I can't.
